intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium juelii, commonly known as the Juel's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and its clusters of small, yellowish to reddish flowers. Native to Central Europe, this species thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its flowers are often visited by various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native environment.
